# Getting Started

This page covers a quick setup and the shortest path to a successful run.

## Install

```bash
uv sync
```

## Run the default pipeline

The default configuration runs the example domain pipeline.

```bash
python -m data_handling.main
```

## Select domains or tags

You can filter which domains run using the top-level config fields.

```bash
python -m data_handling.main active_domains=[example_domain]
python -m data_handling.main active_tags=[daily]
```

## Override configuration values

Override config values at runtime:

```bash
# Change an input path
python -m data_handling.main domains.example_domain.inputs.customers.path="data/customers.csv"

# Change an output path
python -m data_handling.main domains.example_domain.outputs.scores.path="outputs/scores.csv"

# Update a domain parameter
python -m data_handling.main domains.example_domain.params.score_threshold=0.8
```

## Inspect the effective config

If you are not sure which values are active, Hydra can render the full config:

```bash
python -m data_handling.main --cfg job
```
